urn:contentItem:640M-5V11-DYG5-73C8-00000-00Expands Vidette Gold Project in BC and Reports Exploration Results2021-11-03T00:00:00Z2025-11-15T08:52:04ZLexisNexisExpands Vidette Gold Project in BC and Reports Exploration Results

KERMODE RESOURCES LTD. ("KLM-V") - Expands Vidette Gold Project in BC and Reports Exploration - Results

Kermode Resources Ltd. ("Kermode" or the "Company") reports results from the recent field programs at the Vidette Lake gold project ("Vidette") in British Columbia, advises it has expanded the Vidette land package, and provides notice it has satisfied the 2021 work requirements at Vidette.

Increases to Land Position

During 2021, additional mineral claims were acquired for strategic reasons. The new claims staked and purchased bring the contiguous land package to an area of 4,394.15ha (44 sq.km.). All new claims are within the boundary of the original Area of Mutual Agreement as per the contract with Kermode.

The new claims (named X East and Yard West respectively) connect the original claim blocks X and Yard, and cover a copper trend (identified in soil sampling from 1973 with values up to 680ppm Cu). This trend appears to be oriented to the northwest towards the copper anomalies at X East. This trend is obscured by a cap of Miocene-aged basalt which mutes the geochemical and structural continuation of this trend; however, a high gravity zone identified through regional airborne data generated by Geoscience BC can be seen continuing under the cap rock as per the exploration concept that originally motivated field work at the project. The new X East and Yard West cover this target area.

The Amy Claims were purchased in May 2021(40.54ha). These claims were worked historically as part of the wider gold mining efforts in the Vidette area, and small adits were sunk to chase gold-hosting quartz-carbonate veins. The Amy purchase included assay results of samples collected by the previous owner in 2021, which were anomalous in copper and gold. Neither Kermode nor the vendor were involved in this program, so we had no oversight over the quality assurance procedures and will not report the results in detail.

Figure 1: Map of claim blocks constituting the project.

After acquiring the Amy claims, Kermode added two additional claims that host the "Vid 27" mineral showing, which historically has reported an assay of 4.8 grams per tonne ("g/t") gold, 8.9 g/t silver and 0.35% copper from quartz- carbonate veins. The new claims staked and purchased at Amy provide opportunity for Kermode to explore for high-grade gold at surface.

All of the historical work and conclusions described above were carried out by arm's length third parties. Kermode has no information about the mining or assay methods used, or whether the work was carried out under the supervision of a Qualified Person as that term is defined in NI43-101. These historical records should not be relied upon without further work being carried out at and around Eastgate under the supervision of a Qualified Person.

2020 Rock Sampling Results

Kermode reports highlight of results from the 2020 field work previously included in the technical report from March 15, 2021, titled "TECHNICAL REPORT ON THE VIDETTE LAKE PROJECT: THE X AND YARD CLAIM GROUPS" by James Gregory Davison, MSc, PGeo (BC) as follows.

Figure 2: From the X claim, sample #108058 was collected at

Figure 3: From the Yard claim, sample #108056 collected at

As in the Technical Report, James Gregory Davison describes the location of this sample as follows, "... sampling of metavolcanic or gabbroic rocks was conducted further east on the Yard property where outcrops were very limited by overburden cover and primarily comprised of subcrop or frost-heave material."

2021 Exploration Results

In May 2021, 95 soil samples were collected from the Amy and Yard targets and returned from 28.2ppm to 474ppm copper and then from trace to 120 parts per billion gold. This anomaly was consistent over 770 meters and aligned with the compiled historical data through the Vidette area, creating a corridor with a total length of 4.7 kilometers before the trend is obscured by a cap of Miocene basalts. A ground magnetic survey was completed over the Yard-Amy soil grids and showed correlation between magnetic highs and the elevated copper-in-soil levels.

Figure 4: Detailed view of 2021 geophysical and geochemical results.

Further work in 2021 was limited due to the Sparks Lake Forest Fire that placed the entire valley under an evacuation order. A site visit in October 2021 has shown that around 75% of the forest on the property has burned away, with access still limited due to municipal and logging crews on site fixing roads and powerlines. The company plans to conduct further soil, geophysical and geological survey work in 2022.

Andy Randell, project vendor and consulting geologist, said the following. "These results, although limited by the fires, are in-line with our predictions of the geological model and further establish the southern extent of a trend that runs for 17 kilometers from Yard area to the X claim block, where it outcrops again. The copper anomaly appears to form a backbone with auriferous quartz veins radiating off at low angles like ribs in a herringbone pattern, which is based on the concept of a Reidel shear. This regional geological concept provides a framework to estimate vectors for mineralization as we work towards a discovery at Vidette. We plan to spend more time on the site following up on areas where we know of quartz showings that we have not yet sampled."

Kermode CEO Peter Bell says, "Andy and his team do high-quality exploration work. I am grateful to be working with them on this exploration project and am hungry to do more work with them. On behalf of Kermode shareholders, I say thank you to Andy for agreeing to a reduced field work budget this year."

The Vidette Project

The target development and hypothesis for renewed exploration in the area was tied to a recent 'QUEST' airborne gravity survey which showed a correlation between ridges of "gravity highs" and the occurrence of low-sulphidation vein systems within the Spences Bridge Gold Belt. This methodology has been applied to the Yard and X properties.

Qualified Person

The technical information in this news release has been reviewed and approved by Mr. Andy Randell, P. Geo, a Qualified Person responsible for the scientific and technical information contained herein under National Instrument 43-101 standards.

About Kermode

Kermode is a junior mining company hunting for exploration opportunities around the world.
